item.title: Xiaomi's latest flagship smartphone is the MIX Fold 2
item.description: Source: Xiaomi. The MIX Fold 2 is available in Black and Gold colourways. Xiaomi recently debuted its most advanced foldable phone, the Xiaomi MIX Fold 2, in Mainland China. The company also introduced the Xiaomi Pad 5 Pro, Redmi K50 Ultra, and a variety of other ecosystem devices. When unfolded, the Xiaomi MIX Fold 2 measures a mere 5.4mm1, providing a seamless viewing experience across its inner and outer screens.

item.title: Incredible variety, suitable for all
item.description: This document provides an overview of the Samsung Galaxy A72’s features. Samsung Electronics has launched the Samsung Galaxy A52, A52 5G, and A72 smartphones. These devices prioritize desirable features like an impressive camera, high-quality display, and long battery life, embodying the idea that “awesome is for everyone.” Additionally, the Galaxy A series integrates seamlessly with the broader Galaxy ecosystem, which encompasses devices such as Galaxy Buds Pro, Galaxy SmartTag, and Galaxy Tab.

item.title: HTC has unveiled the Desire 620 and 620G
item.description: HTC has introduced the HTC Desire 620 dual sim, the successor to the HTC Desire 610. Source: HTC. The 620G in Milkyway gray. Jack Yang, President of HTC South Asia, stated that the new HTC Desire model provides a balance of modern design, strong processing, and fast connectivity, making it a suitable option for budget-conscious entertainment enthusiasts. The Desire 620 dual sim is equipped with a Snapdragon 410 Qualcomm processor, Android 4.

item.title: The HTC Desire 210, an entry-level dual SIM phone, is priced at less than S$160
item.description: HTC will launch its budget-friendly smartphone, the HTC Desire 210, in Singapore on Wednesday, September 3, 2014. The phone will be sold through various retailers in two colors: Stealth Black and Polar White. A notable feature of the Desire 210 is its dual SIM card support, allowing users to manage personal and work profiles easily from a single device. Source: HTC. “The HTC Desire 210 brings impressive technology and design to the entry-level smartphone market,” stated Jack Yang, President of HTC South Asia.

item.title: Starting today, Singtel will be accepting preorders for the Google Pixel 2 XL
item.description: Singtel announced a partnership with Google to become the official telecommunications provider for the highly anticipated Google Pixel 2 XL in Singapore. Starting November 15th, Singtel customers will have the exclusive opportunity to be the first in Southeast Asia to purchase this new device. Yuen Kuan Moon, Singtel’s Chief Executive Officer for Consumer Singapore, expressed excitement about bringing the Pixel 2 XL to Singapore, highlighting its innovative features that have been eagerly awaited by Android fans.

item.title: Presenting the Samsung Galaxy S20
item.description: Samsung Electronics has launched the Samsung Galaxy S20, its newest flagship device series, featuring a redesigned camera system. “As we begin this decade, 5G will revolutionize how we communicate and experience the world,” said Dr. TM Roh, President and Head of Mobile Communications Business, Samsung Electronics. “With all three Galaxy S20 variants offering 5G connectivity, Samsung provides a next-generation device that will change people’s lives. Its incredible, AI-powered camera lets you capture moments instantly and connect more smoothly with loved ones.

item.title: Phones become unresponsive due to Android vulnerability
item.description: Trend Micro has identified a weakness in the Android operating system that can cause a phone to seem non-functional. Affected phones exhibit symptoms like no ringing or notification sounds, an inability to make calls, and an unresponsive screen. Additionally, locked phones cannot be unlocked. This vulnerability affects Android versions from 4.3 (Jelly Bean) to 5.1.1 (Lollipop), encompassing over half of all Android devices currently in use. Despite being reported to the Android Engineering Team in late May, no official fix has been released through the Android Open Source Project (AOSP).

item.title: In just minutes, Wondershare can transfer Blackberry data to other phones
item.description: Switching from a Blackberry to a new phone? Wondershare might be the solution for you. Their updated MobileTrans software (Version 4.1) enables Blackberry users to move their data to other devices. This includes SMS messages, contact lists, call history, and other data. Source: Wondershare website Wondershare claims that MobileTrans is the first and only solution that can transfer Blackberry SMS messages to an iPhone. With this software and a Blackberry desktop backup, users can transfer data without connecting both their old and new phones to a computer.

item.title: LifeProof has unveiled new cases designed specifically for the latest iPhones
item.description: LifeProof has introduced the FLiP, their first iPhone case to include built-in storage. “Our iPhones are essential for capturing photos and videos, providing long-lasting battery life, and keeping us connected,” stated Jim Parke, LifeProof’s CEO. Source: LifeProof. “Apple is known for its continuous innovation, and LifeProof aims to complement the phone’s sleek design with cases that maintain optimal performance.” Engineered to withstand drops from 2 meters, the single-piece FLiP case incorporates a wallet-like panel on the back, providing storage for cards and cash.

item.title: Enhance car safety with 360-degree hands-free device viewing
item.description: Sprint-Cass, the sole distributor of Taiwanese brand Digidock in Singapore, is introducing a new line of Digidock mobile device holders for vehicles at IT Show 2015, happening from March 19th to 22nd at the Suntec Convention Centre. These holders are designed for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. Every Digidock holder features a 360-degree swivel joint, allowing users to securely position their smartphones or tablets at any desired angle. Engineered for simple attachment and removal, the holders come with interchangeable cradles and universal mounts.

item.title: Singapore residents are being targeted by a phone-based phishing campaign, according to DBS
item.description: DBS Bank has issued a warning to residents of Singapore about a phishing scam making use of automated phone calls. Given their customer base of over 4 million in Singapore alone, it is highly likely that scammers will connect with a DBS account holder. The scam, as reported on the DBS website, begins with an automated voice message in either English or Mandarin. The recipient is told they have an urgent message from DBS Bank and instructed to press either “0” or “1”.

item.title: Pre-orders for the Sony Mobile Xperia XZs are now open in Singapore
item.description: Source: Sony Mobile. The Xperia XZs. In Singapore, the Sony Xperia XZs can be pre-ordered exclusively at Sony’s retail locations (six stores and two centers) until April 14th. Pre-orders will come with a complimentary accessory package, including MDR-XB70BT Extra Bass Bluetooth In-ear Headphones (S$149 value), a DK60 Micro USB Charging Dock (S$58 value), and a clear crystal phone case (S$20.90 value)*. Additionally, a special offer allows customers to purchase a tempered glass screen protector for the Xperia XZs at a discounted price of S$14.

item.title: Singtel introduces a new prepaid SIM card that also functions as a travel card
item.description: Singtel has introduced the hi!Tourist EZ-Link SIM card, a first in Asia, which combines a prepaid SIM card with a stored value travel card usable for Singapore’s public transportation. Source: Singtel. The hi!Tourist EZ-Link SIM card is the first in Asia to combine travel and phone services. Priced at S$18, this SIM card provides 100 GB of 4G data, unlimited access to social media and messaging apps, and 1 GB of roaming data for select countries in the region.

item.title: Singtel introduces a special upgrade offer for owners of 2G phones
item.description: Singtel has introduced a special offer as they prepare to discontinue 2G services in Singapore, starting in April 2017. Source: Singtel. The Alcatel Onetouch 2052x is available for S$48, and the Onetouch Pop D3 is priced at S$95. Prepaid customers can take advantage of S$70 in free talk time and 350MB of data, along with an additional S$30 in free talk time when they trade in a 2G phone. Postpaid customers on Silver Plan Combo 1 and 2 will receive a 20% discount on their monthly bills.

item.title: Kickstarter's main focus is on recording directly from your phone to the computer
item.description: Recap S2, a compact device designed to connect to smartphones for saving calls to external devices like computers or voice recorders, is seeking funding on Kickstarter. Source: Kickstarter website Inventor Igor Ramos highlights the device’s user-friendliness, stating its compatibility with any device equipped with a combo port for input and a standard stereo microphone port for output. Ramos assures users that Recap recordings maintain the original call quality. A video demonstration is available here.

item.title: Transfer files from your phone without using up your mobile data
item.description: Xender, a Chinese app, simplifies phone-based file sharing without incurring mobile data costs using peer-to-peer technology. For device-to-device transfers, Xender creates a local Wi-Fi hotspot that nearby users can join. This allows for the seamless sharing of photos, music, files, and apps between phones, proving particularly useful when upgrading to a new device. Xender boasts unlimited file sizes, cross-platform compatibility, and transfer speeds up to 50 times faster than Bluetooth.

item.title: TaxiPixi cab booking app is now available in Kuala Lumpur and will soon be expanding to more countries
item.description: TaxiPixi, a cab booking app, has expanded its reach to Malaysia and will be pre-installed on Celkon phones in India, Sri Lanka, South Africa, and Nepal. Developed by India-based On Time Technologies, TaxiPixi launched in Malaysia this week. Celkon, a mobile phone manufacturer, will pre-install the app on its devices in several countries. Pradeep Yerraguntla, Celkon’s Head of Digital, stated that Celkon will promote the app through its app store and website, targeting consumers in India, Sri Lanka, South Africa, and Nepal.

item.title: Exciting news: Samsung unveils the Galaxy A54 and Galaxy A34
item.description: Source: Samsung. The Galaxy A54 5G phone in Awesome Lime. Samsung Electronics has introduced the Galaxy A54 and Galaxy A34, two smartphones that enhance Samsung Galaxy’s dedication to delivering exceptional mobile experiences. These latest additions to the well-received Galaxy A series empower users to capture smooth and sharp videos, view content clearly even in bright environments, and enjoy extended battery life. “Providing a top-tier experience is becoming increasingly crucial for our consumers’ daily lives.

item.title: The Xiaomi 13 Series makes its debut in Singapore
item.description: Source: Xiaomi Singapore. Pictured are the Xiaomi 13 Series phones (from left): Xiaomi 13 in white, Xiaomi 13 in Flora Green, and Xiaomi 13 in black. Xiaomi launched its latest top-tier smartphone series, the Xiaomi 13 Series, in Singapore. The Xiaomi 13 and Xiaomi 13 Pro are the result of a collaboration with Leica, aiming to redefine the smartphone photography landscape for users in Singapore. Developed in partnership with Leica, these flagship phones boast a triple camera system featuring Leica’s professional-grade lenses.

item.title: The Alcatel IDOL 4 Series offers enhanced multimedia features
item.description: Boom Key provides personalized features for taking pictures, enjoying music, and improving user experience. Audio experience powered by Waves and JBL, including high-quality JBL headphones included in the box. Three-way reversibility: sound travels from left to right or front to back, and the user interface adapts when flipped upside down. VR-in-the-box: VR goggles create an immersive virtual reality experience anywhere, anytime* ALCATEL has introduced its premium IDOL 4 and IDOL 4S smartphones, offering an enhanced multimedia experience.

item.title: Two Internet Connections For Consistent Phone Calls
item.description: The way businesses use phone systems is evolving. Traditional analog and PBX systems are being replaced by mobile, computer-integrated, and cloud-based solutions. While these new features offer significant advantages, maintaining high-quality, reliable voice communication is crucial. The challenge lies in leveraging advanced technologies without compromising service quality, a balance we must strike as there’s no turning back from this technological evolution. Staying with outdated analog or ISDN PRI systems is no longer sustainable.

item.title: Shopee has started a sale on mobile phones in Malaysia
item.description: Shopee, a leading mobile marketplace in Southeast Asia and Taiwan, is holding a Lowest Price Guaranteed Mobile Phone Sale in Malaysia until April 27, 2017. This sale offers discounts of up to 80% on popular smartphone brands like Apple, Samsung, and Huawei. Shopee is committed to offering the lowest prices and will compensate shoppers 120% of the price difference if a phone is found cheaper on another platform. This sale features phones priced as low as RM60, with deals on models like the Samsung Galaxy J2 Prime and the Apple iPhone 5.

item.title: A new budget-friendly Lumia is about to be released
item.description: Source: Microsoft. The Lumia 430. Microsoft has released the Lumia 430 Dual SIM, its most budget-friendly Lumia smartphone that can be upgraded to Windows 10*. Priced at approximately S$119, the Lumia 430 joins Microsoft’s affordable smartphone lineup alongside the Lumia 435, which features Lumia Camera. Equipped with Windows Phone 8.1, a Qualcomm Snapdragon processor with a 1.2GHz dual-core CPU, and pre-installed Microsoft Office, Skype, and OneDrive, the Lumia 430 Dual SIM enables users to be productive at work, enjoy entertainment, and stay connected while on the move.

item.title: The inexpensive cellphone you recently purchased may be counterfeit
item.description: The global black market for counterfeit and substandard cell phones is a significant issue, costing the industry an estimated US$6 billion each year, as reported in a recent study by the Mobile Manufacturers Forum (MMF). This comprehensive analysis, “Counterfeit/Substandard Mobile Phones - A Resource Guide for Governments”, examines the prevalence of these phones across all major brands. According to MMF Secretary General Michael Milligan, research suggests approximately 148 million counterfeit or substandard cell phones were sold in 2013 alone, primarily through established retail channels.

item.title: Singtel announces pricing for iPhone SE
item.description: Source: Apple. The iPhone SE. Singtel has revealed its plans to offer Apple’s 4-inch iPhone SE starting March 31, 2016. Customers can pre-order the device now. A 16 GB model with the most affordable plan, costing S$27.90 per month for two years, is priced at S$350. The telecom provider recently conducted a crowdsourced study, highlighting its superior 4G network speed and coverage in Singapore. The study, based on data from IDA’s MyConnection SG crowdsourced survey and 4G Mobile Service Coverage results, positioned Singtel as a frontrunner.

item.title: 2020 Christmas Gift Guide: Must-Have Gadgets for the Holiday Season
item.description: As the year ends, it’s the perfect time to treat yourself. Check out these gadgets for relaxation and maybe even work: OPPO Find X2 Pro smartphone The OPPO Find X2 Pro blends technology and elegant design. Marketed as “a cinema in your hand,” it boasts a 120 Hz QHD+ Ultra Vision screen with exceptional resolution, color, refresh rate, and brightness. Enjoy immersive audio and video with its powerful dual speakers and Dolby Atmos.

item.title: Entries are now being accepted for the inaugural HUAWEI Film Awards
item.description: Filmmakers in the Asia Pacific region can win prizes for films made on Huawei smartphones. The top prize includes $20,000 and a trip to Bangkok for the awards ceremony. An event in Singapore on December 21 will showcase a film by local director Boris Boo. Source: Huawei. Poster for the HFA. Huawei has launched its first film awards, the HUAWEI Film Awards (HFA), in the Asia Pacific region. The competition aims to encourage filmmakers and content creators to use Huawei smartphones to demonstrate their creativity.

item.title: Huawei introduces the cover shot-ready HUAWEI P10 and HUAWEI P10 PLUS
item.description: Huawei recently launched its P10 and P10 Plus smartphones in Singapore, emphasizing their advanced camera capabilities developed in partnership with Leica. The event showcased the phones’ ability to “make every shot a cover shot,” highlighting features like the Leica dual-camera system and artistic portrait enhancements. To illustrate the phones’ capabilities, Huawei created an artistic studio atmosphere. Attendees could experience the phones firsthand and view a portrait gallery captured by renowned photographers using the P10 and P10 Plus.

item.title: Save the Cell Phone, Save the World
item.description: Cell phones are frequently overlooked as a source of environmental concern, valuable resources, and potential income. While seemingly harmless, these devices contain toxic materials and represent a significant waste problem due to their short lifespans and frequent replacement. A cell phone’s small size and durable exterior might make it seem environmentally benign, but the internal components tell a different story. Lead, cadmium, arsenic, mercury, plastics, and glass are all found within these devices.

item.title: The HTC One E9+ dual sim will be available in Singapore starting August 29th
item.description: Source: HTC. The HTC One E9+ dual sim in rose gold. HTC has introduced the HTC One E9+ dual sim in Singapore. This lightweight smartphone boasts a sizable 2K display and injects vibrant colors into the signature flagship design. “This latest addition to our HTC One E series capitalizes on the success of our flagship phones, offering both sophistication and style,” stated Faisal Siddiqui, President of HTC South Asia. “The HTC One E9+ dual sim represents a continuation of HTC’s commitment to innovation and design, showcasing a large 5.

item.title: The HTC Desire 510 provides budget-friendly LTE capabilities
item.description: HTC’s most budget-friendly LTE smartphone is hitting the shelves just days after the company launched the Desire 210 in Singapore. Starting September 6, 2014, you can find the HTC Desire 510 at mobile carriers and major retailers across Singapore. This device boasts a quad-core LTE processor, a 4.7” display, and runs on Android 4.4. Source: HTC. “While the industry has been buzzing about the impact of 4G, it’s easy to overlook that only a handful of high-end devices truly utilize this technology,” says HTC CEO, Peter Chou.

item.title: The Galaxy A53 5G and Galaxy A33 5G are both awesome options
item.description: Source: Samsung. The new Galaxy A series handsets. Samsung Electronics has released the Galaxy A53 5G and Galaxy A33 5G, incorporating the latest technology to provide a comprehensive mobile experience at an affordable price. These new Galaxy A series phones boast 5G connectivity, robust security features, and a sleek, eco-conscious design. They’re powered by a new processor, include Samsung’s AI camera, a large, responsive display, and a long-lasting battery.

item.title: Fynd, the startup that offers on-demand phone repair services, is planning to expand in the Southeast Asia region
item.description: Source: Fynd. The Fynd team: from left, Ian De La Cruz, CTO; Jack Leow, Chief Strategy Officer; Albert Tirtohadi, CEO; and Alex Devendran, COO. Fynd, a Singapore-based on-demand platform for mobile device repair, has secured S$520,000 (US$385,000) in pre-Series A funding. This investment will allow the company to expedite its expansion across Southeast Asia. Referred to as the “Uber for mobile phone repair,” Fynd has commenced operations in Hong Kong and aims to establish a presence in Jakarta by year-end.

item.title: LG has introduced the G3 Beat, a mid-tier model of the G3, in Korea
item.description: Source: LG. LG Electronics (LG) introduced the LG G3 Beat in Korea on July 18th. This mid-range version of their flagship G3 smartphone provides a comparable high-quality experience, incorporating the Floating Arc design and rapid Laser Auto Focus technology in a smaller form factor with a 5-inch thin-bezel display. Dr. Jong-seok Park, President and CEO of LG Electronics Mobile Communications Company, emphasized the growing consumer demand for a balanced mix of aesthetics, functionality, performance, and affordability.

item.title: There is debate over whether mobile phones can cause cancer, with some believing they can and others disagreeing
item.description: There have been many concerns about mobile phones and cancer risks. Since the first mobile phone’s debut in 1984 and their rise in popularity in the 1990s, it’s taken time to study the long-term effects of mobile phone radiation, as some cancers take years to manifest. We might only now be starting to see the impact. A recent study in Pathophysiology suggests that radiation from mobile and cordless phones could contribute to a specific brain tumor called glioma.

item.title: The enhanced Alcatel-Lucent OpenTouch Suite for SMB from ALE simplifies collaboration and boosts productivity
item.description: Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise, operating under the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise brand, helps small and medium businesses provide a streamlined user experience and enhanced onsite mobility for their employees, while ensuring business continuity. This is achieved through the latest update of their product, Alcatel-Lucent OpenTouch Suite for SMB. The latest improvements to OpenTouch Suite for SMB focus on increasing productivity and efficiency. This is achieved through expanded communication and collaborative tools, as well as enabling employees to access the company environment from any location, at any time, using mobile applications.

item.title: HTC has launched the HTC Desire 826 dual sim, promising an exceptional mobile audio experience
item.description: Source: HTC. The Blue Lagoon version. HTC is enhancing the mobile audio experience with its Desire 826 dual sim phone, featuring HTC BoomSound and Dolby Audio surround sound. This makes HTC the first smartphone manufacturer to integrate dual front-facing stereo speakers, a precisely adjusted sound profile, and Dolby’s decoding technology for a comprehensive multi-channel audio solution. This combination provides listeners with a level of audio depth and range not typically found in mobile devices.

item.title: Huawei has launched the HUAWEI nova 3i
item.description: Singapore is among the first countries globally to introduce the HUAWEI nova 3i, a midrange smartphone equipped with AI-powered front-facing dual cameras. Huawei aims to make high-end technology and value accessible to budget-conscious consumers, according to Cheng Jiangfei, Managing Director of Huawei Singapore Consumer Business Group. He emphasized that the HUAWEI nova 3i combines stylish design with advanced AI features, offering exceptional quality and functionality at an affordable price. Notable features of the HUAWEI nova 3i include:

item.title: HTC reveals the new HTC One M9
item.description: Source: HTC. The HTC One M9 will be available globally in dual-tone silver and rose gold¹ , single-tone gunmetal grey, single-tone gold and dual-tone gold and pink from mid-March. The silver and rose gold model is pictured. HTC has launched its latest flagship phone, the HTC One M9. This new addition to the HTC One line combines the best features of the award-winning HTC One M7 and HTC One M8.
